text: Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts.
50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation.
The US learned the hard way, not to trust other political powers.
It is difficult to imagine the CIA without operatives in other nations.
What was the government thinking?
The author takes the reader through a whirlwind of emotions, while keeping the reader on his toes with action and surprises.
You find out that the US did have operatives in other nations, but they were bought off!
Some tried to communicate the activities of other nations, but mysteriously disappears.
In chapter after chapte.
espionage and counter-espionage whirls across the pages of this imaginary tale.
Although fictional, one at times believes that various post-war situations could have easily occured.
The action and surprises are on the mark.
In one part of the suspense,, the author takes the reader on a ride in Russia, where an agent will be sent into the city of Moscow.
It depicts accurate attitudes that occured by citizens and the government of Russia after the war.
It is a mind-boggling account of the state of the city.
Suspicion is the undercurrant of every word spoken; of every action taken.
The best part is about the agent.
She is a woman and seductress.
She is a great character, being incredibly intelligent and sensual.
Too many Russians loved her persona, one rarely seen in women in Russia.
She won over the hearts and minds of many.
At one point, almost predictabily, she felt tempted to disappear with another new identity so she could be with the man she promised herself to not fall in love with.
Overall, the book is a real page turner.
Enjoy!
